poem:
**Greenland Awakening**

In the cold clasp of morning,  
pundits and politics whirl,  
while Greenland's silent ice listens,  
eavesdropper to distant ambitions.  
The horizon stretches, indifferent,  
to men in suits and scattered maps,  
as a coalition of snowflakes whispers,  
unconcerned with claims,  
embracing only  
the ever-enduring sweep  
of the Arctic's breath.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Greenland braced for JD Vance visit after Trump’s claim US will inevitably take over island – Europe live 1.05pm GMT Greenland parties sign coalition agreement to form new government - video As reported earlier (10:11), four of the five parties in the new Greenlandic parliament are set to sign a coalition agreement to form the next government today. The event is just starting now and you can watch it along with us here: 1.01pm GMT". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Greenland braced for JD Vance visit after Trump’s claim US will inevitably take over island – Europe live 1.05pm GMT Greenland parties sign coalition agreement to form new government - video As reported earlier (10:11), four of the five parties in the new Greenlandic parliament are set to sign a coalition agreement to form the next government today. The event is just starting now and you can watch it along with us here: 1.01pm GMT
